main event: A man and his wife observed a bright, slow-moving object in the sky for about 3 minutes while attending a concert in Newburg, New York on July 13, 1954.
interesting points: The object was described as similar to a fluorescent lamp or cigar-shaped, with no noise or exhaust visible.
The object was moving at a speed comparable to a reconnaissance aircraft, but much higher in the sky.
The sighting occurred as the sun was setting in a clear sky.
No other unusual activity or sightings were reported to the local police or weather stations.
The report was investigated by the USAF's Project Blue Book program, but the conclusions were deemed confidential.
